page.title: 06Education
page.content: Education has flourished for 400 years. The{Grammar School}founded by Archbishop Sandys in 1585 is now a museum and contains a fine example of a 17th century school library. The{ {Pre-school Playgroup}is run by parents. There is a{Primary School}in a modern building and senior children attend the{Comprehensive Schools}in Coniston or Ambleside. Courses for adults under the auspices of Cumbria Education Committee, Liverpool and Newcastle Universities are held in the area. The W.I., Young Farmers, and W.E.A. also provide courses.
